data.title: Randomized sounds should be implemented
data.body:
I would like to see a feature where sounds are randomized if there is more then one called for. Let's say we have a pillbox that reports:

REPORT: GUN 15, GUN 18

The pill box would have a 50/50 chance of choosing Gun 15 over Gun 18, and vice versa. Same with:

REPORT: Gun 1, gun 2, gun 3

Except, now the pillbox has a 33/33/33 chance of picking each of these sounds.

data.title: Crash: Music Related

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
```
System.IO.EndOfStreamException: Unable to read beyond the end of the stream.
   at System.IO.__Error.EndOfFile()
   at System.IO.BinaryReader.ReadByte()
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.AudLoader.LoadSound(Stream s)
   at OpenRA.Sound.LoadSound(String filename)
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.Cache`2.get_Item(T key)
   at OpenRA.Sound.PlayMusicThen(MusicInfo m, Action then)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.MusicPlayerLogic.Play(String song)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.MusicPlayerLogic.<Play>m__1C2()
   at OpenRA.Sound.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager, Viewport viewPort)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

EDIT: Mud is the cause of the crash. Some thing is wrong with this file.

data.title: Cloak Generator Trait
data.body:
You have implemented the Gap Generator finally. Now for something similar

I would like something like the stealth generator from Tiberian Sun to be possible in the engine. This is needed for something in my mod.

The cloak generator trait should also have parameters to only cloak certain units. For example:

Building A can cloak Air units, vehicles, and infantry, while Unit A can only cloak infantry and buildings.

data.title: Additional Sound Extentions should be implemented
data.body:
Right now, the game supports .aud files coded to a specific format. It should support more.

.aud files are not in a great quality, and are hard to convert/find. A few other files that should be implemented:
.ogg
.wav

and if at all possible:
.mp3

data.title: Add specific target weapon targeting
data.body:
Right now, a unit uses both its primary and secondary fire against all targets. This should have an option to not be the case.

A command should be implemented for a primary weapon to only fire against certain targets, the secondary fire to only fire against certain targets, and vice versa. This is useful for, say, adding a machine gun to tanks that only fires on infantry.

data.title: more accurate unit's counting to load water transport
data.body:
I push this ticket just to discuss RA balance.
In fact you can fill 5 APC and load them into water transport, so you move 25 infantry by water in result.
Probably that's not really good behavior. Then I would suggest to count also amount of units APC has inside and probably load only 1 full APC. If 1st APC is not full, load 2nd APC without worrying about amount of units it has.

data.title: local game lags every half second
data.body:
Installed OpenRA 2 days ago and tried creating a local game with only me just so i could get back into the groove of it (love it btw).  it was playing fine for an hour until i quit.  however when i started another private game with an easy ai after about 3 minutes the game would get very choppy, every half second it would lag for about a half second.  turning on the performance monitor, the tick time, tick idle and pathfinder lines would spike off the screen every half second.  render would flux between about 5.8-9.2 and tick would be .8-2.2, though it was difficult to read; couldn't get a screen cap.  all movement within the game would get choppy, the mouse movements would even lag which prevented continued playing.  this would continue indefinitely as my patience would wear thin.   i tried it again 3 times with the same results.  when trying playing with just me it would work fine.

CPU: AMD Athlon II x3 435, 2.90 GHz
VideoL ATI Radeon HD 4350 with up-to-date driver

data.title: replaced explosion numbers with names
added names for explosions, to eventually replace numbers.
suggestion: make cliffs behave like walls for lower side attackers
data.body: Cliffs should stop direct fire attacks (e.g. tank guns) if they're fired from the lower side. Projectiles originating from the topside would not be affected.

data.title: change die-1 sequence to InfDeath: 1 instead of InfDeath: 0
data.body:
It's a little unintuitive that InfDeath: 0 leads to the animation sequence "die-1". I think certain things were mistakenly labelled  as a result. I also made this mistake. 

If someone wants to change it so that InfDeath: 1 leads to Die-1 and so on, I will update any InfDeath values appropriately, where needed in the cnc mod.

data.title: Allow filtering of passengers for showing on the deck with RenderCargo
data.body: By passenger type

data.title: allow multiple units in a crate
data.body:
Would be nice to have multiple units in a crate (original C&C behaviour). Will be using this for a squad of infantry.

Maybe something like:

```
    GiveUnitCrateAction@squad:
        SelectionShares: 20
        Unit: e1,e1,e3,e5,e6
```

Would be even nicer if they could be randomized from a list, with probabilities for each.

data.title: allow building speed to be set by CustomSellValue
data.body: In C&C 95, Refineries (which come with Harvesters) and Helipads (which come with Orcas/Helis) have CustomSellValues (the value of the building without factoring in the unit that came with it, for when you sell it). They build faster because of the lower costs of the building itself. But in OpenRA they build at the same speed as any other building. I think it should be made possible to build at the speed of the CustomSellValue.

data.title: Give Mammoth 8-sec. cooldown for heal, like in RA.
reveal shroud a little better
data.body:
I think units could reveal shroud a bit better.
In this screenshot, as the buggy explores, he does not see ahead of him the full 2 squares sight range that he should. His detection circle is set to 2, and his RevealsShroud: is set to 2. http://i.imgur.com/cAOqb.jpg 
I believe the original behaviour in C&C was that if your sight range == 2, then you can always see 2 full squares around you. OpenRA seems different. Screenshot of original game: http://i.imgur.com/FYDqI.jpg

Another pic. http://i.imgur.com/IMo1X.jpg. I noticed the range circle goes half way into the 2nd square, not fully around it.

data.title: allow -negation of certain target types
data.body:
In C&C Classic, some weapons (machine guns, lasers, etc.) cannot fire at walls.
So to reproduce this behavior, I added the following to ^Wall:

```
    TargetableBuilding:
        TargetTypes: Ground, Wall
```

I then edited the M16 weapon to say, thinking it would work. 

```
    ValidTargets: Ground, -Wall
```

Can this be made valid, so that certain weapons cannot target certain units/buildings if their targety type is negated, even though they also belong to a class that is otherwise a permitted ValidTarget?

data.title: Lift vehicles if RenderCargo: and using an air transporter
data.body: The RenderCargo: YAML setting in CnC was created for the hovercraft. It already works for the Dune 2000 Carryall. Optics should be enhanced somehow as it looks a little stupid when the unit stays on the ground when the carryall goes higher. When you unload it there is a debug message "Debug: Warning: actor harv: bad vis"

data.title: missiles explode prematurely once target unit dies
data.body:
A missile whose target dies will suddenly explode in mid-air. This is problematic because it damages your own units. I think the expected behaviour should be to continue to the last coordinates of target and explode. Another option is to self-terminate harmlessly. But there are definitely some units where you'd want and expect it to keep going (e.g. V2, any missile artillery...). I think in most cases people want and expect it to keep going. 
So if someone wants the "self-terminate harmlessly" option, it could be an option in .yaml code for some weapons, with the default behaviour to continue to where the target was, and then deliver payload.

data.title: show spectators in diplomacy
make tooltips show up in cnc
data.body:
Tool tips do not shot up over units in the build menu.

It only shows price and time required to build.

data.title: Add distance-to-MCV constraint to building placement, for anti-basewalk
data.body: Somewhere around 10 cells.

data.title: revived the Dune 2000 mod
data.body:
Psydev asked for this to be pulled into the next release. This commits adds a fixed DATA.R8 reader, a bash script to create the necessary SHPs with RA.Utility and fixes all YAMLs to start the d2k mod (together with the RA mod as it still heavily depends on it) without crashes. Currently there is a splash screen, some recolored interface files for each faction and I added some Atreides buildings and the carryall.

However I did not add install rules for the Dune 2000 mod as I don't consider this production quality at all. There is a strange flickering bug (maybe palette related). It seems that the Dune 2000 tilesize is not supported by the engine yet. Some buildings don't render completely as frames require to be layed over each other (like the RA weapon factory).

I removed the bitrotted default mod and the palettetest (incorporated into d2k mod).

data.title: added optional UPNP support, added Graphics.Renderer to UI Settings
data.body: I created a new pull-request because the old one was spammed with recent changes that have nothing to do it with it.

data.title: Game.ConnectTo does not work
data.body:
On server side: server detects new client correctly.
On client side: nothing different from normal start, main menu is shown.
Version: release2012-0504

data.title: Replay viewer should allow filters
data.body:
I would like replays of games with no human opponents to be saved in a separate sub-folder.
I generally have little interest in reviewing games vs. A.I. and it's hard to distinguish them from the multiplayer games.

I also have so many games vs. A.I. to sift through because I do so much playtesting, making the problem much worse. 

thanks,

data.title: better error messages for duplicate keys
data.body:
Instead of just
`[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.ArgumentException:`
`An element with the same key already exists in the dictionary.`
I want to know which key is duplicate. This would ease modding a lot when depending on another mod with Requires:

data.title: Website: comment spam
data.body: Comments in the old http://openra.res0l.net/news/ are heavily link-spammed.

data.title: Simplepause
data.body:
The what: This branch demonstrates the possibility of a pause function for the OpenRA game engine.

The why: when playing with a friend or family member, it is sometimes desired to pause the game. For instance to get a drink or something to eat, when the phone rings, etc. Pausing the game will not ruin your life then, and it also won't ruin your game.

The how: the usage is very simple now. During the game, one can press the PAUSE key on the keyboard, and the game will pause. The game can be un-paused by pressing the key again.

In the background the following is done to make this work:
- The client sends PAUSE GAME REQUEST to the server.
- The server replies with PAUSE GAME to all clients.
- From now on, the ordermanager.tick() will not be invoked
  Note: pause messages are immediate orders (so one can unpause).

Some remarks:
- Orders can be given, but are queued. The UI will not update these orders until the game un-pauses.
- It has been tested with 1vs1.

Possible future extentions:
- Adding a pause option in the game-menu (for keyboards without a pause-key)
- Freeze the game with a "pause screen", where the user can un-pause, resign, chat, and change settings
- By the game-creating adding a setting which enables/disables the pause-option.

data.title: Replay feature cause crash and missing setting to turn it off
data.body: There is no way to disable the replay feature for mods! Also when testing it will crash if I have multiple instances of openra because of this feature "The process cannot access the file 'C:\Users\Christer\Documents\OpenRA\Replays\OpenRA-2012-05-16T193620Z.rep' because it is being used by another process."
